creator: mariano@fuegolabs.com
text: attached is a patch file that fixes it. there was a todo there :)

creator: mariano@fuegolabs.com
text:
Created attachment 6269
the patch files with JspC.java and Jasper41mangler.java

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
This is cool. I am assuming that you are using Tomcat4.1.24, that apparently
being the first version of a jspc that does do directories? 

I like the patch to jspc, but need some more clarification on the mangler. I see
why you want the .java extension, but question stripping off the .jsp extension.
Tomcat 4.1 keeps that to map something like class.jsp to class_jsp.java and so
avoid reserved words problems. Does your version of tomcat implement a different
mangling policy

creator: john.mcquillan@openjawtech.com
text:
Seeing the same problem with 1.6.0 - I have the compiler set to "jasper41".
Turning on debug suggests that its checking the wrong filename. For example, it 
checks for "test_jsp" when jasper is creating "test.java"

Jspc is unmaintable and now deprecated. Please upgrade to the version that 
ships with tomcat 5 or later. Marking as WONTFIX.
creator: stevel@apache.org
